1.text: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ, according to a command of God our Saviour, and of the Lord Jesus Christ our hope,

2.text: to Timotheus—genuine child in faith: Grace, kindness, peace, from God our Father, and Christ Jesus our Lord,

3.text: according as I did exhort thee to remain in Ephesus—I going on to Macedonia—that thou mightest charge certain not to teach any other thing,

4.text: nor to give heed to fables and endless genealogies, that cause questions rather than the building up of God that is in faith:—

5.text: And the end of the charge is love out of a pure heart, and of a good conscience, and of faith unfeigned,

6.text: from which certain, having swerved, did turn aside to vain discourse,

7.text: willing to be teachers of law, not understanding either the things they say, nor concerning what they asseverate,

8.text: and we have known that the law is good, if any one may use it lawfully;

9.text: having known this, that for a righteous man law is not set, but for lawless and insubordinate persons, ungodly and sinners, impious and profane, parricides and matricides, men-slayers,

10.text: whoremongers, sodomites, men-stealers, liars, perjured persons, and if there be any other thing that to sound doctrine is adverse,

11.text: according to the good news of the glory of the blessed God, with which I was entrusted.

12.text: And I give thanks to him who enabled me—Christ Jesus our Lord—that he did reckon me stedfast, having put me to the ministration,

13.text: who before was speaking evil, and persecuting, and insulting, but I found kindness, because, being ignorant, I did it in unbelief,

14.text: and exceedingly abound did the grace of our Lord, with faith and love that is in Christ Jesus:

15.text: stedfast is the word, and of all acceptation worthy, that Christ Jesus came to the world to save sinners—first of whom I am;

16.text: but because of this I found kindness, that in me first Jesus Christ might shew forth all long-suffering, for a pattern of those about to believe on him to life age-during:

17.text: and to the King of the ages, the incorruptible, invisible, only wise God, is honour and glory—to the ages of the ages! Amen.

18.text: This charge I commit to thee, child Timotheus, according to the prophesies that went before upon thee, that thou mayest war in them the good warfare,

19.text: having faith and a good conscience, which certain having thrust away, concerning the faith did make shipwreck,

20.text: of whom are Hymenaeus and Alexander, whom I did deliver to the Adversary, that they might be instructed not to speak evil.
